page.title: 01LANDSCAPE,TOPOGRAPHY
page.content: This area is dominated by the moorland areas known as FFOREST FACH - the Little Forest - which is a triangular upland measuring about 2 km East-West and 3 km North-South. To the East lies the valley known as CWM TREWEREN. This stream flows into the Afon Senni at Defynnog, about 1 km upstream of the Senni with the River Usk at Senny- bridge. To the West of Fforest Fach is the valley known as CWM CRAI, this river flowing into the Usk between Trecastle and Sennybridge. The bare moorland of Fforest Fach rises to a height of 380 metres. Both valleys are between 250 and 200 metres. The area is sparsely populated and the settlement everywhere comprises small isolated farms. The area lies within the BRECON BEACONS NATIONAL PARK.
